full_threads.body:
Thanks for the update.

Are you able to look at that event as I registered for an invoice and nothing was sent so I'm not sure it's working

Get Outlook for iOS

Hi Glen,

Regarding the best way to create events moving forward, the easiest method is to simply Duplicate an existing event that is already set up correctly (e.g., one that is already set to "In-Person").

I’ve attached a screenshot below showing where the Duplicate button is located. This ensures all your settings carry over without you having to start from scratch every time.


To answer your questions about the payments and invoices:

1. Why "Pay by Invoice" is considered "Offline" & "Manual" When a user selects "Pay by Invoice," no money is exchanged electronically at that moment. The system simply records a promise to pay.
  • Why it's manual: Because the funds are transferred via bank transfer (outside of the website), the website has no way of knowing when the money actually hits your bank account. It requires a human to check the bank and manually mark the booking as "Paid."
2. The Difference: Website vs. Stripe
  • The Website (The Administrator): It generates the Tax Invoice. Since you are using the "Pay by Invoice" method, the website is the only system involved right now. It emails the PDF invoice so the attendee knows how much to pay.
  • Stripe (The Bank): It processes Credit Card payments. It acts like an EFTPOS terminal. If a user pays by card, Stripe takes the money instantly and sends a receipt.

In summary: For your current setup, the Website handles the paperwork (Invoices), and Stripe is only involved if they choose to pay by Credit Card directly.

I hope this clarifies things!

If there's anything else you'd like help with, always happy to help however we can.

action.text: Adriane Roa assigned to Adriane Roa

Hi Glen,

Thanks so much for getting back to us - happy to clarify this for you.

Regarding the pending bookings, you can approve them by following these steps:
  • Go to Events → Bookings in the admin area
  • Set the filter to Future Events → Needs Attention
  • Click Filter (this step is important)
  • Select the booking(s) you’d like to approve
  • Choose Bulk Actions → Approve, then apply

I’ve included screenshots for reference to make this easier to follow.

Payment gateway & invoices:
  • Currently, the Pay with: Invoice option is set up as an offline payment method, which means payments and invoices are processed manually.
  • If you’d like invoices to be generated automatically, attendees would need to pay by credit card at the time of booking. Could you let us know if this setup works best for you?

Thanks again, and please don’t hesitate to reach out if anything is unclear - we’re always happy to help!

Hi Glenn,

Thanks so much for getting back to us — happy to help clarify this for you

Pending bookings
The bookings you’re seeing are currently awaiting approval. You can approve them by following these steps:
  1. Go to Events → Bookings in the admin area
  2. Set the filter to Future Events → Needs Attention
  3. Click Filter (this step is important)
  4. Select the booking(s) you’d like to approve
  5. Choose Bulk Actions → Approve, then apply
I’ve included screenshots below to make this a bit easier to follow.

Payment gateway & invoices
At the moment, the Pay with: Invoice option is set up as an offline payment method, which means payments and invoices are processed manually.
To make sure everything is set up in the way that works best for you, could you let us know whether you’d prefer attendees to pay by credit card at the time of booking, with the invoice generated automatically?

Thanks again, and please don’t hesitate to reach out if anything is unclear — we’re always happy to help.

(Time: 5mins)
-joel
